snippet.title: Synovial Joints \- man Anatomy
snippet.description: Synovial joints are most evolved and therefore most mobile type of joints. They possess the following characteristic features; There articular surfaces are covered with hyaline cartilage.

snippet.title: Synovial joints \- definition of Synovial joints in the ...
snippet.description: joint (joint) the site of junction or union between bones, especially one that allows motion of the bones. Various kinds of joints. Fibrous: A, syndesmosis (tibiofibular); B, suture (skull).

snippet.title: Synovial joints \- Medicalook Human Anatomy organs
snippet.description: SYNOVIAL JOINTS ANATOMY Synovial joints are free moving joints that are encapsulated in synovial fluid. They can be categorized by the movements which they permit as well as the shapr of the anterior surface.

snippet.title: 6 Types of Synovial Joints | LIVESTRONG.COM
snippet.description: There are many types of joints in the body including fibrous, cartilaginous and synovial joints. The synovial joints are characterized by the presence of synovial fluid within a space that encapsulates the articulating surfaces (surfaces that touch each other) of the joint. The ...

snippet.title: Synovial Joint \- SportsMed Forum
snippet.description: By Dr Dan Laptoiu, MD, Bucharest, Romania. Synovial joints . Five classes of tissue make up synovial joints: Bone; Cartilage; Synovium; Synovial fluid; Tensile tissues: ligament and tendon, attached at entheses

snippet.title: synovial joint (anatomy) -- Encyclopedia Britannica
snippet.description: In vertebrates the joints between bones are constructed in a variety of ways. They fall, however, into two main categories, the synovial joint and the nonsynovial joint.

snippet.title: Synovial Joints and other Types of Joints
snippet.description: Synovial Joints are one of the most common joints in mammals, they are also the joint that can be moved the most. There are several different synovial joints, including: gliding joints, hinge joints, pivot joints, condyloid joints, saddle joints, ball and socket joints and compound joints.
